pageContext.description: Width as: "51.5 mm, 35 mm, 16 mm",  Thickness as: "(average) 2 mm", good condition + very well made.  Smooth edges sharpened: very light
pageContext.publications: Bateman Ten Years Digging (p.  115), Museum Catalogue.
pageContext.collection: Sheffield Museum,  J93-440, Bateman Collection.  G.135 [or 9.135.]
pageContext.site: England, Staffordshire, near Dee[ Dale, 1848. (in a Tummlus)
pageContext.remarks: Found in a Tumulus near Deep Dale, under the shoulder of a skeleton which was lying on its left side. In the earth filling above, was found an arrowhead of flint.
